title: Why Russell Westbrook breaks PVR formulas

hook.text:
Russell Westbrook broke basketball so bad, we had to create a new rule just for him.

[On-screen: "THE WESTBROOK PARADOX 🤯"]

Here's the stat that makes NO sense...

explanation.text:
Westbrook 2017: 48.1% TUSG (highest ever) + 25.11 PVR (really good).

But here's the problem - he had 5.4 turnovers per game. That should KILL his PVR.

[Show graphic: AST/TOV ratio affects multiplier]

Normal players: AST/TOV < 1.8 = 1.8x assist multiplier
Elite playmakers: AST/TOV > 1.8 = 2.3x assist multiplier

Westbrook's 10.4 assists with 5.4 TOV = 1.93 ratio. Just barely elite.

example.text:
That's The Westbrook Rule: obscene usage + high assists + high turnovers = still works.

[Show: 31.6 PPG + 10.4 APG > 5.4 TOV]

The volume was SO high, the efficiency still mattered. Pure math magic.

cta.text:
Follow for more stats that break your brain. Link in bio for the Westbrook Rule calculator.
